titles.title: Bucket Drowning Prevention Act of 1993
A bill to require that 4-gallon to 6-gallon buckets distributed in commerce bear a permanent label warning of a potential drowning hazard to young children, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4687-4688)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 4/20/1993--Introduced. Bucket Drowning Prevention Act of 1993 - Establishes a consumer product safety standard that would require warning labels on four- to six-gallon buckets. Requires each label to state "Children Can Fall into Bucket and Drown--Keep Children Away From Buckets With Even a Small Amount of Liquid" and to include a picture of a child falling into a bucket.
